animal.name: Giraffe
animal.description: The giraffe has both the longest neck and the longest tail of any land mammal.

animal.name: Coyote
animal.description: Coyotes live in packs of about six, but hunt in pairs.
animal.hint: Coyotes are adapted to live in both extremes of temperature.

animal.name: Kangaroo
animal.description: The kangaroo is an unofficial symbol of Australia, appearing on the country's coat of arms.
animal.hint: Lives in habitats common to Australia.

animal.name: Dog
animal.description: There are thought to be over 400 million dogs in the world. The dog is the species with the most variation in appearance between members of the same species.
animal.hint: Likes wide open spaces to run around in.

animal.name: Hippo
animal.description: The closest living relatives to Hippopotami are whales and porpoises.

animal.name: Donkey
animal.description: There are more than 40 million donkeys in the world.

animal.name: Penguin
animal.description: Not all penguins live in arctic regions. The Galapagos penguin lives near the equator.

animal.name: Cheetah
animal.description: The fastest land animal in the world. In addition, they are one of the only felines with rectractable claws.

animal.name: Ostrich
animal.description: Its powerful legs can be used to kick attackers in times of danger.

animal.name: Nautilus
animal.description: The shell describes a perfect logarithmic spiral.

animal.name: Pronghorn
animal.description: The pronghorn is one of the world's fastest land creatures.

animal.name: Llama
animal.description: Llamas are quite intelligent and can be taught basic tasks.

animal.name: European Robin
animal.description: In the British Isles, robins are unwary of humans and will approach them.
animal.hint: Lives in trees in temporate climates.

animal.name: Barn owl
animal.description: Their ears are asymmetrically placed to give a better sense of location.
animal.hint: Hunts in open spaces and lives in trees.

animal.name: Mountain goat
animal.description: The lifespan of wild mountain goats is limited by the wearing down of their teeth.
animal.hint: Thrives in steep, high, barren climates.

animal.name: Bighorn sheep
animal.description: The males often fight for the right to mate with ewes.
animal.hint: Is able to survive and hunt in very dry climates.

animal.name: Arctic tern
animal.description: These birds sometimes sppok other birds to make them drop their caught food, so that the tern can steal it.

animal.name: Canada goose
animal.description: They often feel threatened by humans, and spread their wings and make loud noise to ward us off.

animal.name: Whooper swan
animal.description: Even after their offspring have matured, they often return to their parents during winter.

animal.name: African Wild Dog
animal.description: These canines don't fight for dominance, but agree their hierarchy by consensus.

animal.name: Dolphin
animal.description: Dolphins are believed to be one of the most intelligent species in the world.

animal.name: Swordfish
animal.description: Swordfish prefer to slash at their adversaries rather than impale them.
